001package com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.ipt_hq;
002
003import com.badlogic.gdx.Gdx;
004import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.*;
005import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Batch;
006import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion;
007import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.glutils.ShaderProgram;
008import com.badlogic.gdx.math.Affine2;
009import com.badlogic.gdx.math.MathUtils;
010import com.badlogic.gdx.math.Matrix4;
011import com.badlogic.gdx.utils.NumberUtils;
012
013import java.nio.Buffer;
014
015/**
016 * A substitute for {@link com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.SpriteBatch} that adds an additional attribute to store an
017 * extra color's worth of channels, used to modify the intensity and chromatic channels of a color by multiplication
018 * (calle the "tweak") while the primary color affects the color additively (just called the color, often drawn from
019 * {@link Palette} or generated with {@link ColorTools}). This ColorfulBatch uses the IPT (HQ) color space where
020 * SpriteBatch normally uses RGBA, which means that in the batch color, r maps to additive intensity, g maps to additive
021 * protan, b maps to additive tritan, and a maps to multiplicative alpha. Additive values cause no change when they are
022 * 0.5, but cause a sharp increase at 1.0 and a sharp decrease at 0.0. In the tweak, r maps to multiplicative intensity,
023 * g maps to multiplicative protan, b maps to multiplicative tritan, and a maps to "exponential-like" contrast. Like
024 * with the additive values, 0.5 causes no change for multiplicative values, but you can think of the existing color as
025 * being temporarily shifted down by 0.5 for each of the IPT channels, so each IPT channel's range is -0.5 to 0.5 before
026 * being multiplied by the corresponding tweak value (times 2.0, which means multiplicative tweak values less than 0.5
027 * make colors closer to grayscale and values greater than 0.5 make colors more vibrant) and then shifted back to its
028 * prior range. Contrast is a special value; 0.5 still means "no change," but lower values will make intensity changes
029 * less distinct between similar colors, while higher values will "sharpen" the changes in intensity.
030 * <br>
031 * This is different from the {@link com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.ipt.ColorfulBatch} class in the ipt package; this
032 * class gamma-corrects colors (with a gamma of 2.0 for simplicity's sake) and uses a power of 0.43 or 1.0/0.43 for some
033 * operations internally whereas the non-HQ version doesn't use any exponentiation. The HQ is short for High Quality.
034 * <br>
035 * Created by Tommy Ettinger on 12/14/2019.
036 */
037public class ColorfulBatch implements Batch {
038    public static final int SPRITE_SIZE = 24;
039    public static final String TWEAK_ATTRIBUTE = "a_tweak";
040
041    private Mesh mesh;
042
043    private final float[] vertices;
044    private int idx = 0;
045    private Texture lastTexture = null;
046    private float invTexWidth = 0, invTexHeight = 0;
047
048    private boolean drawing = false;
049
050    private final Matrix4 transformMatrix = new Matrix4();
051    private final Matrix4 projectionMatrix = new Matrix4();
052    private final Matrix4 combinedMatrix = new Matrix4();
053
054    private boolean blendingDisabled = false;
055    private int blendSrcFunc = GL20.GL_SRC_ALPHA;
056    private int blendDstFunc = GL20.GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA;
057    private int blendSrcFuncAlpha = GL20.GL_SRC_ALPHA;
058    private int blendDstFuncAlpha = GL20.GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA;
059
060    private final ShaderProgram shader;
061    private ShaderProgram customShader = null;
062    private boolean ownsShader;
063
064    protected float color = Palette.GRAY;
065    private final Color tempColor = new Color(0.5f, 0.5f, 0.5f, 1f);
066
067    /**
068     * A constant packed float that can be assigned to this ColorfulBatch's tweak with {@link #setTweak(float)} to make
069     * all of the tweak adjustments virtually imperceptible. When this is set as the tweak, it won't change the
070     * intensity multiplier or intensity contrast, and it won't change either chromatic value multiplier.
071     */
072    public static final float TWEAK_RESET = ColorTools.ipt(0.5f, 0.5f, 0.5f, 0.5f);
073    protected float tweak = TWEAK_RESET;
074
075    /** Number of render calls since the last {@link #begin()}. **/
076    public int renderCalls = 0;
077
078    /** Number of rendering calls, ever. Will not be reset unless set manually. **/
079    public int totalRenderCalls = 0;
080
081    /** The maximum number of sprites rendered in one batch so far. **/
082    public int maxSpritesInBatch = 0;
083
084    /** Constructs a new ColorfulBatch with a size of 1000, one buffer, and the default shader.
085     * @see #ColorfulBatch(int, ShaderProgram) */
086    public ColorfulBatch() {
087        this(1000, null);
088    }
089
090    /** Constructs a ColorfulBatch with one buffer and the default shader.
091     * @see #ColorfulBatch(int, ShaderProgram)  */
092    public ColorfulBatch(int size) {
093        this(size, null);
094    }
095
096    /** Constructs a new ColorfulBatch. Sets the projection matrix to an orthographic projection with y-axis point upwards, x-axis
097     * point to the right and the origin being in the bottom left corner of the screen. The projection will be pixel perfect with
098     * respect to the current screen resolution.
099     * <p>
100     * The defaultShader specifies the shader to use. Note that the names for uniforms for this default shader are different than
101     * the ones expect for shaders set with {@link #setShader(ShaderProgram)}. See {@link #createDefaultShader()}.
102     * @param size The max number of sprites in a single batch. Max of 10922.
103     * @param defaultShader The default shader to use. This is not owned by the ColorfulBatch and must be disposed separately. */
104    public ColorfulBatch(int size, ShaderProgram defaultShader) {
105        // 65535 is max vertex index, so 65535 / 6 vertices per sprite = 10922 sprites max.
106        if (size > 10922) throw new IllegalArgumentException("Can't have more than 10922 sprites per batch: " + size);
107
108        Mesh.VertexDataType vertexDataType = (Gdx.gl30 != null) ? Mesh.VertexDataType.VertexBufferObjectWithVAO : Mesh.VertexDataType.VertexArray;
109
110        mesh = new Mesh(vertexDataType, false, size * 4, size * 6,
111                new VertexAttribute(VertexAttributes.Usage.Position, 2, ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE),
112                new VertexAttribute(VertexAttributes.Usage.ColorPacked, 4, ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE),
113                new VertexAttribute(VertexAttributes.Usage.TextureCoordinates, 2, ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0"),
114                new VertexAttribute(VertexAttributes.Usage.ColorPacked, 4, TWEAK_ATTRIBUTE));
115
116        projectionMatrix.setToOrtho2D(0, 0, Gdx.graphics.getWidth(), Gdx.graphics.getHeight());
117
118        vertices = new float[size * SPRITE_SIZE];
119
120        int len = size * 6;
121        short[] indices = new short[len];
122        short j = 0;
123        for (int i = 0; i < len; i += 6, j += 4) {
124            indices[i] = j;
125            indices[i + 1] = (short)(j + 1);
126            indices[i + 2] = (short)(j + 2);
127            indices[i + 3] = (short)(j + 2);
128            indices[i + 4] = (short)(j + 3);
129            indices[i + 5] = j;
130        }
131        mesh.setIndices(indices);
132
133        if (defaultShader == null) {
134            shader = createDefaultShader();
135            ownsShader = true;
136        } else
137            shader = defaultShader;
138    }
139
140    /** Returns a new instance of the default shader used by ColorfulBatch for GL2 when no shader is specified. */
141    public static ShaderProgram createDefaultShader () {
142        String vertexShader = "attribute vec4 " + ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
143                + "attribute vec4 " + ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
144                + "attribute vec2 " + ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0;\n"
145                + "attribute vec4 " + TWEAK_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
146                + "uniform mat4 u_projTrans;\n"
147                + "varying vec4 v_color;\n"
148                + "varying vec4 v_tweak;\n"
149                + "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n"
150                + "varying float v_lightFix;\n"
151                + "\n"
152                + "void main()\n"
153                + "{\n"
154                + "   v_color = " + ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
155                + "   v_color.a = v_color.a * (255.0/254.0);\n"
156                + "   v_tweak = " + TWEAK_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
157                + "   v_tweak.a = pow(v_tweak.a * (255.0/254.0) + 0.5, 1.709);\n"
158                + "   v_lightFix = 1.0 + pow(v_tweak.a, 1.41421356);\n"
159                + "   v_texCoords = " + ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0;\n"
160                + "   gl_Position =  u_projTrans * " + ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
161                + "}\n";
162        String fragmentShader =
163                "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
164                        "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
165                        "precision mediump float;\n" +
166                        "#else\n" +
167                        "#define LOWP \n" +
168                        "#endif\n" +
169                        "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
170                        "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
171                        "varying LOWP vec4 v_tweak;\n" +
172                        "varying float v_lightFix;\n" +
173                        "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
174                        "const vec3 forward = vec3(0.43);\n" +
175                        "const vec3 reverse = vec3(1.0 / 0.43);\n" +
176                        "void main()\n" +
177                        "{\n" +
178                        "  vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords );\n" +
179                        "  vec3 ipt = mat3(0.40000, 4.45500, 0.80560, 0.40000, -4.8510, 0.35720, 0.20000, 0.39600, -1.1628) *" +
180                        "             pow(mat3(0.313921f, 0.151693f, 0.017753f, 0.639468f, 0.748209f, 0.109468f, 0.0465970f, 0.1000044f, 0.8729690f) \n" +
181                        "             * (tgt.rgb * tgt.rgb), forward);\n" +
182                        "  ipt.x = clamp(pow(ipt.x, v_tweak.a) * v_lightFix * v_tweak.r + v_color.r - 0.55, 0.0, 1.0);\n" +
183                        "  ipt.yz = clamp((ipt.yz * v_tweak.gb + v_color.gb - 0.5) * 2.0, -1.0, 1.0);\n" +
184                        "  ipt = mat3(1.0, 1.0, 1.0, 0.097569, -0.11388, 0.032615, 0.205226, 0.133217, -0.67689) * ipt;\n" +
185                        "  gl_FragColor = vec4(sqrt(clamp(" +
186                        "                 mat3(5.432622, -1.10517, 0.028104, -4.67910, 2.311198, -0.19466, 0.246257, -0.20588, 1.166325) *\n" +
187                        "                 (sign(ipt) * pow(abs(ipt), reverse))," +
188                        "                 0.0, 1.0)), v_color.a * tgt.a);\n" +
189                        "}";
190
191
192        ShaderProgram shader = new ShaderProgram(vertexShader, fragmentShader);
193        if (!shader.isCompiled()) throw new IllegalArgumentException("Error compiling shader: " + shader.getLog());
194        return shader;
195    }
196
197    @Override
198    public void begin () {
199        if (drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.end must be called before begin.");
200        renderCalls = 0;
201
202        Gdx.gl.glDepthMask(false);
203        if (customShader != null)
204            customShader.bind();
205        else
206            shader.bind();
207        setupMatrices();
208
209        drawing = true;
210    }
211
212    @Override
213    public void end () {
214        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before end.");
215        if (idx > 0) flush();
216        lastTexture = null;
217        drawing = false;
218
219        GL20 gl = Gdx.gl;
220        gl.glDepthMask(true);
221        if (isBlendingEnabled()) gl.glDisable(GL20.GL_BLEND);
222    }
223
224    @Override
225    public void setColor (Color tint) {
226        color = tint.toFloatBits();
227    }
228
229    /**
230     * Sets the color to the result of {@link ColorTools#ipt(float, float, float, float)} on the same arguments.
231     * For the IPT parameters, 0.5f is a neutral value (causing no change), while for alpha, 1.0f is a neutral
232     * value. For IPT, higher values will add to the corresponding channel, while lower values will subtract from it.
233     * @see ColorTools#ipt(float, float, float, float) 
234     * @param intensity like lightness; additive; ranges from 0 (black) to 1 (white)
235     * @param protan cool-to-warm, roughly; additive; ranges from 0 (green/cyan/blue) to 1 (orange/red/purple)
236     * @param tritan artificial-to-natural, very roughly; additive; ranges from 0 (blue/purple) to 1 (green/yellow/orange)
237     * @param alpha opacity, from 0 to 1; multiplicative
238     */
239    @Override
240    public void setColor (float intensity, float protan, float tritan, float alpha) {
241        color = ColorTools.ipt(intensity, protan, tritan, alpha);
242    }
243
244    public void setColor (final float color) {
245        setPackedColor(color);
246    }
247
248    public void setIntColor(final int color) {
249        this.color = NumberUtils.intBitsToFloat(Integer.reverseBytes(color & -2));
250    }
251
252    /**
253     * Sets the color with the given IPT and A parameters from 0 to 255.
254     * For the IPT parameters, 127 or 128 is a neutral value (causing no change), while for alpha, 255 is a neutral
255     * value. For IPT, higher values will add to the corresponding channel, while lower values will subtract from it.
256     * @see ColorTools#ipt(float, float, float, float) 
257     * @param intensity like lightness; additive; ranges from 0 (black) to 255 (white)
258     * @param protan cool-to-warm, roughly; additive; ranges from 0 (green/cyan/blue) to 255 (orange/red/purple)
259     * @param tritan artificial-to-natural, very roughly; additive; ranges from 0 (blue/purple) to 255 (green/yellow/orange)
260     * @param alpha opacity, from 0 to 255 (254 is equivalent, since the lowest bit is discarded); multiplicative
261     */
262    public void setIntColor(int intensity, int protan, int tritan, int alpha) {
263        color = NumberUtils.intBitsToFloat((alpha << 24 & 0xFE000000)
264                | (tritan << 16 & 0xFF0000) | (protan << 8 & 0xFF00) | (intensity & 0xFF));
265    }
266
267    @Override
268    public void setPackedColor (final float color) {
269        this.color = color;
270    }
271
272    @Override
273    public Color getColor () {
274        final int intBits = NumberUtils.floatToRawIntBits(color);
275        Color color = tempColor;
276        color.r = (intBits & 0xff) / 255f;
277        color.g = ((intBits >>> 8) & 0xff) / 255f;
278        color.b = ((intBits >>> 16) & 0xff) / 255f;
279        color.a = ((intBits >>> 24) & 0xff) / 255f;
280        return color;
281    }
282
283    @Override
284    public float getPackedColor () {
285        return color;
286    }
287
288    /**
289     * Sets the multiplicative and contrast parts of the shader's color changes. 0.5 is a neutral value that should have
290     * minimal effect on the image; using {@code (0.5f, 0.5f, 0.5f, 0.5f)} will effectively remove the tweak.
291     * @param intensity like lightness; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (black) to 1 (white)
292     * @param protan cool-to-warm, roughly; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (green and red are removed) to 1 (green-ness or red-ness is emphasized)
293     * @param tritan artificial-to-natural, very roughly; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (blue and yellow are removed) to 1 (blue-ness or yellow-ness is emphasized)
294     * @param contrast affects how lightness changes; ranges from 0 (low contrast, cloudy look) to 1 (high contrast, sharpened look) 
295     */
296    public void setTweak (float intensity, float protan, float tritan, float contrast) {
297        tweak = ColorTools.ipt(intensity, protan, tritan, contrast);
298    }
299
300    public void setTweak (final float tweak) {
301        this.tweak = tweak;
302    }
303    
304    public float getTweak () {
305        return tweak;
306    }
307
308    /**
309     * Takes the tweak as an int in the format: intensity (8 bits), protan (8 bits), tritan (8 bits), contrast (7 bits),
310     * (1 ignored bit at the end). An example would be 0x7820206E, which slightly darkens (with intensity 0x78, slightly
311     * below the halfway point of 0x80), significantly reduces colorfulness with protan and tritan multipliers of 0x20
312     * (closer to 0, so most colors will be almost grayscale), and slightly reduces contrast (with contrast and the
313     * ignored bit as 0x6E, which is less than the halfway point).
314     * @param tweak the tweak to use as an integer, with intensity in the most significant bits and contrast in least
315     */
316    public void setIntTweak(final int tweak) {
317        this.tweak = NumberUtils.intBitsToFloat(Integer.reverseBytes(tweak & -2));
318    }
319
320    /**
321     * Sets the multiplicative and contrast parts of the shader's color changes. 127 is a neutral value that should have
322     * minimal effect on the image; using {@code (127, 127, 127, 127)} will effectively remove the tweak.
323     * @param intensity like lightness; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (black) to 255 (white)
324     * @param protan cool-to-warm, roughly; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (green and red are removed) to 255 (green-ness or red-ness is emphasized)
325     * @param tritan artificial-to-natural, very roughly; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (blue and yellow are removed) to 255 (blue-ness or yellow-ness is emphasized)
326     * @param contrast affects how lightness changes; ranges from 0 (low contrast, cloudy look) to 255 (high contrast, sharpened look) 
327     */
328    public void setIntTweak(int intensity, int protan, int tritan, int contrast) {
329        tweak = NumberUtils.intBitsToFloat((contrast << 24 & 0xFE000000)
330                | (tritan << 16 & 0xFF0000) | (protan << 8 & 0xFF00) | (intensity & 0xFF));
331    }
332
333    /**
334     * A convenience method that sets both the color (with {@link #setColor(float)}) and the tweak (with
335     * {@link #setTweak(float)}) at the same time.
336     * @param color the additive components and alpha, as a packed float
337     * @param tweak the multiplicative components and contrast, as a packed float
338     */
339    public void setTweakedColor(final float color, final float tweak) {
340        setColor(color);
341        setTweak(tweak);
342    }
343
344    /**
345     * A convenience method that sets both the color (with {@link #setColor(float, float, float, float)}) and the tweak
346     * (with {@link #setTweak(float, float, float, float)}) at the same time.
347     * @param intensityAdd like lightness; additive; ranges from 0 (black) to 1 (white)
348     * @param protanAdd cool-to-warm, roughly; additive; ranges from 0 (green/cyan/blue) to 1 (orange/red/purple)
349     * @param tritanAdd artificial-to-natural, very roughly; additive; ranges from 0 (blue/purple) to 1 (green/yellow/orange)
350     * @param alphaMul opacity, from 0 to 1; multiplicative
351     * @param intensityMul like lightness; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (black) to 1 (white)
352     * @param protanMul cool-to-warm, roughly; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (green/cyan/blue) to 1 (orange/red/purple)
353     * @param tritanMul artificial-to-natural, very roughly; multiplicative; ranges from 0 (blue/purple) to 1 (green/yellow/orange)
354     * @param contrast foggy-to-sharp lightness contrast; affects most other components; ranges from 0 (flat, foggy lightness) to 1 (sharp, crisp lightness)
355     */
356    public void setTweakedColor(final float intensityAdd, final float protanAdd,
357                                final float tritanAdd, final float alphaMul,
358                                final float intensityMul, final float protanMul,
359                                final float tritanMul, final float contrast) {
360        setColor(intensityAdd, protanAdd, tritanAdd, alphaMul);
361        setTweak(intensityMul, protanMul, tritanMul, contrast);
362    }
363
364    @Override
365    public void draw (Texture texture, float x, float y, float originX, float originY, float width, float height, float scaleX,
366                      float scaleY, float rotation, int srcX, int srcY, int srcWidth, int srcHeight, boolean flipX, boolean flipY) {
367        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
368
369        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
370
371        if (texture != lastTexture)
372            switchTexture(texture);
373        else if (idx == vertices.length) //
374            flush();
375
376        // bottom left and top right corner points relative to origin
377        final float worldOriginX = x + originX;
378        final float worldOriginY = y + originY;
379        float fx = -originX;
380        float fy = -originY;
381        float fx2 = width - originX;
382        float fy2 = height - originY;
383
384        // scale
385        if (scaleX != 1 || scaleY != 1) {
386            fx *= scaleX;
387            fy *= scaleY;
388            fx2 *= scaleX;
389            fy2 *= scaleY;
390        }
391
392        // construct corner points, start from top left and go counter clockwise
393        final float p1x = fx;
394        final float p1y = fy;
395        final float p2x = fx;
396        final float p2y = fy2;
397        final float p3x = fx2;
398        final float p3y = fy2;
399        final float p4x = fx2;
400        final float p4y = fy;
401
402        float x1;
403        float y1;
404        float x2;
405        float y2;
406        float x3;
407        float y3;
408        float x4;
409        float y4;
410
411        // rotate
412        if (rotation != 0) {
413            final float cos = MathUtils.cosDeg(rotation);
414            final float sin = MathUtils.sinDeg(rotation);
415
416            x1 = cos * p1x - sin * p1y;
417            y1 = sin * p1x + cos * p1y;
418
419            x2 = cos * p2x - sin * p2y;
420            y2 = sin * p2x + cos * p2y;
421
422            x3 = cos * p3x - sin * p3y;
423            y3 = sin * p3x + cos * p3y;
424
425            x4 = x1 + (x3 - x2);
426            y4 = y3 - (y2 - y1);
427        } else {
428            x1 = p1x;
429            y1 = p1y;
430
431            x2 = p2x;
432            y2 = p2y;
433
434            x3 = p3x;
435            y3 = p3y;
436
437            x4 = p4x;
438            y4 = p4y;
439        }
440
441        x1 += worldOriginX;
442        y1 += worldOriginY;
443        x2 += worldOriginX;
444        y2 += worldOriginY;
445        x3 += worldOriginX;
446        y3 += worldOriginY;
447        x4 += worldOriginX;
448        y4 += worldOriginY;
449
450        float u = srcX * invTexWidth;
451        float v = (srcY + srcHeight) * invTexHeight;
452        float u2 = (srcX + srcWidth) * invTexWidth;
453        float v2 = srcY * invTexHeight;
454
455        if (flipX) {
456            float tmp = u;
457            u = u2;
458            u2 = tmp;
459        }
460
461        if (flipY) {
462            float tmp = v;
463            v = v2;
464            v2 = tmp;
465        }
466
467        final float color = this.color;
468        final float tweak = this.tweak;
469        final int idx = this.idx;
470        vertices[idx] = x1;
471        vertices[idx + 1] = y1;
472        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
473        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
474        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
475        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
476
477        vertices[idx + 6] = x2;
478        vertices[idx + 7] = y2;
479        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
480        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
481        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
482        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
483
484        vertices[idx + 12] = x3;
485        vertices[idx + 13] = y3;
486        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
487        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
488        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
489        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
490
491        vertices[idx + 18] = x4;
492        vertices[idx + 19] = y4;
493        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
494        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
495        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
496        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
497        this.idx = idx + 24;
498    }
499
500    @Override
501    public void draw (Texture texture, float x, float y, float width, float height, int srcX, int srcY, int srcWidth,
502                      int srcHeight, boolean flipX, boolean flipY) {
503        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
504
505        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
506
507        if (texture != lastTexture)
508            switchTexture(texture);
509        else if (idx == vertices.length) //
510            flush();
511
512        float u = srcX * invTexWidth;
513        float v = (srcY + srcHeight) * invTexHeight;
514        float u2 = (srcX + srcWidth) * invTexWidth;
515        float v2 = srcY * invTexHeight;
516        final float fx2 = x + width;
517        final float fy2 = y + height;
518
519        if (flipX) {
520            float tmp = u;
521            u = u2;
522            u2 = tmp;
523        }
524
525        if (flipY) {
526            float tmp = v;
527            v = v2;
528            v2 = tmp;
529        }
530
531        final float color = this.color;
532        final float tweak = this.tweak;
533        final int idx = this.idx;
534        vertices[idx] = x;
535        vertices[idx + 1] = y;
536        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
537        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
538        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
539        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
540
541        vertices[idx + 6] = x;
542        vertices[idx + 7] = fy2;
543        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
544        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
545        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
546        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
547
548        vertices[idx + 12] = fx2;
549        vertices[idx + 13] = fy2;
550        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
551        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
552        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
553        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
554
555        vertices[idx + 18] = fx2;
556        vertices[idx + 19] = y;
557        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
558        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
559        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
560        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
561        this.idx = idx + 24;
562    }
563
564    @Override
565    public void draw (Texture texture, float x, float y, int srcX, int srcY, int srcWidth, int srcHeight) {
566        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
567
568        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
569
570        if (texture != lastTexture)
571            switchTexture(texture);
572        else if (idx == vertices.length) //
573            flush();
574
575        final float u = srcX * invTexWidth;
576        final float v = (srcY + srcHeight) * invTexHeight;
577        final float u2 = (srcX + srcWidth) * invTexWidth;
578        final float v2 = srcY * invTexHeight;
579        final float fx2 = x + srcWidth;
580        final float fy2 = y + srcHeight;
581
582        final float color = this.color;
583        final float tweak = this.tweak;
584        final int idx = this.idx;
585        vertices[idx] = x;
586        vertices[idx + 1] = y;
587        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
588        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
589        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
590        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
591
592        vertices[idx + 6] = x;
593        vertices[idx + 7] = fy2;
594        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
595        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
596        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
597        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
598
599        vertices[idx + 12] = fx2;
600        vertices[idx + 13] = fy2;
601        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
602        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
603        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
604        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
605
606        vertices[idx + 18] = fx2;
607        vertices[idx + 19] = y;
608        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
609        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
610        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
611        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
612        this.idx = idx + 24;
613    }

617        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
618
619        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
620
621        if (texture != lastTexture)
622            switchTexture(texture);
623        else if (idx == vertices.length) //
624            flush();

627        final float fy2 = y + height;
628
629        final float color = this.color;
630        final float tweak = this.tweak;
631        final int idx = this.idx;
632        vertices[idx] = x;
633        vertices[idx + 1] = y;
634        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
635        vertices[idx + 3] = u;

655        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
656        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;

662    @Override
663    public void draw (Texture texture, float x, float y) {
664        draw(texture, x, y, texture.getWidth(), texture.getHeight());

666
667    @Override
668    public void draw (Texture texture, float x, float y, float width, float height) {
669        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
670
671        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
672
673        if (texture != lastTexture)
674            switchTexture(texture);
675        else if (idx == vertices.length) //
676            flush();
677
678        final float fx2 = x + width;
679        final float fy2 = y + height;
680        final float u = 0;
681        final float v = 1;
682        final float u2 = 1;
683        final float v2 = 0;
684
685        final float color = this.color;
686        final float tweak = this.tweak;
687        final int idx = this.idx;
688        vertices[idx] = x;
689        vertices[idx + 1] = y;
690        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
691        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
692        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
693        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
694
695        vertices[idx + 6] = x;
696        vertices[idx + 7] = fy2;
697        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
698        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
699        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
700        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
701
702        vertices[idx + 12] = fx2;
703        vertices[idx + 13] = fy2;
704        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
705        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
706        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
707        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
708
709        vertices[idx + 18] = fx2;
710        vertices[idx + 19] = y;
711        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
712        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
713        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
714        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
715        this.idx = idx + 24;
716    }
717
718    /**
719     * This is very different from the other overloads in this class; it assumes the float array it is given is in the
720     * format libGDX uses to give to SpriteBatch, that is, in groups of 20 floats per sprite. ColorfulBatch uses 24
721     * floats per sprite, to add tweak per color, so this does some conversion.
722     * @param texture the Texture being drawn from; usually an atlas or some parent Texture with lots of TextureRegions
723     * @param spriteVertices not the same format as {@link #vertices} in this class; should have a length that's a multiple of 20
724     * @param offset where to start drawing vertices from {@code spriteVertices}
725     * @param count how many vertices to draw from {@code spriteVertices} (20 vertices is one sprite)
726     */
727    @Override
728    public void draw (Texture texture, float[] spriteVertices, int offset, int count) {
729        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
730
731        count = (count / 5) * 6;
732        int verticesLength = vertices.length;
733        int remainingVertices = verticesLength;
734        if (texture != lastTexture)
735            switchTexture(texture);
736        else {
737            remainingVertices -= idx;
738            if (remainingVertices == 0) {
739                flush();
740                remainingVertices = verticesLength;
741            }
742        }
743        int copyCount = Math.min(remainingVertices, count);
744        final float tweak = this.tweak;
745
746        ////old way, breaks when libGDX code expects SPRITE_SIZE to be 20
747        //System.arraycopy(spriteVertices, offset, vertices, idx, copyCount);
748        ////new way, thanks mgsx
749        for (int s = offset, v = idx, i = 0; i < copyCount; i += 6) {
750            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
751            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
752            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
753            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
754            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
755            vertices[v++] = tweak;
756        }
757        idx += copyCount;
758        count -= copyCount;
759        while (count > 0) {
760            offset += (copyCount / 6) * 5;
761            flush();
762            copyCount = Math.min(verticesLength, count);
763            ////old way, breaks when libGDX code expects SPRITE_SIZE to be 20
764            //System.arraycopy(spriteVertices, offset, vertices, 0, copyCount);
765            ////new way, thanks mgsx
766            for (int s = offset, v = 0, i = 0; i < copyCount; i += 6) {
767                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
768                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
769                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
770                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
771                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
772                vertices[v++] = tweak;
773            }
774            idx += copyCount;
775            count -= copyCount;
776        }
777    }
778
779    /**
780     * Meant for code that uses ColorfulBatch specifically and can set an extra float (for the color tweak) per vertex,
781     * this is just like {@link #draw(Texture, float[], int, int)} when used in other Batch implementations, but expects
782     * {@code spriteVertices} to have a length that is a multiple of 24 instead of 20.
783     * @param texture the Texture being drawn from; usually an atlas or some parent Texture with lots of TextureRegions
784     * @param spriteVertices vertices formatted as this class uses them; length should be a multiple of 24
785     * @param offset where to start drawing vertices from {@code spriteVertices}
786     * @param count how many vertices to draw from {@code spriteVertices} (24 vertices is one sprite)
787     */
788    public void drawExactly (Texture texture, float[] spriteVertices, int offset, int count) {
789        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
790
791        int verticesLength = vertices.length;
792        int remainingVertices = verticesLength;
793        if (texture != lastTexture)
794            switchTexture(texture);
795        else {
796            remainingVertices -= idx;
797            if (remainingVertices == 0) {
798                flush();
799                remainingVertices = verticesLength;
800            }
801        }
802        int copyCount = Math.min(remainingVertices, count);
803
804        System.arraycopy(spriteVertices, offset, vertices, idx, copyCount);
805        idx += copyCount;
806        count -= copyCount;
807        while (count > 0) {
808            offset += copyCount;
809            flush();
810            copyCount = Math.min(verticesLength, count);
811            System.arraycopy(spriteVertices, offset, vertices, 0, copyCount);
812            idx += copyCount;
813            count -= copyCount;
814        }
815    }
816
817    @Override
818    public void draw (TextureRegion region, float x, float y) {
819        draw(region, x, y, region.getRegionWidth(), region.getRegionHeight());
820    }
821
822    @Override
823    public void draw (TextureRegion region, float x, float y, float width, float height) {
824        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
825
826        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
827
828        Texture texture = region.getTexture();
829        if (texture != lastTexture) {
830            switchTexture(texture);
831        } else if (idx == vertices.length) {
832            flush();
833        }
834        final float fx2 = x + width;
835        final float fy2 = y + height;
836        final float u = region.getU();
837        final float v = region.getV2();
838        final float u2 = region.getU2();
839        final float v2 = region.getV();
840
841        final float color = this.color;
842        final float tweak = this.tweak;
843        final int idx = this.idx;
844        vertices[idx] = x;
845        vertices[idx + 1] = y;
846        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
847        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
848        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
849        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
850
851        vertices[idx + 6] = x;
852        vertices[idx + 7] = fy2;
853        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
854        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
855        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
856        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
857
858        vertices[idx + 12] = fx2;
859        vertices[idx + 13] = fy2;
860        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
861        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
862        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
863        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
864
865        vertices[idx + 18] = fx2;
866        vertices[idx + 19] = y;
867        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
868        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
869        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
870        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
871        this.idx = idx + 24;
872    }
873
874    @Override
875    public void draw (TextureRegion region, float x, float y, float originX, float originY, float width, float height,
876                      float scaleX, float scaleY, float rotation) {
877        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
878
879        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
880
881        Texture texture = region.getTexture();
882        if (texture != lastTexture) {
883            switchTexture(texture);
884        } else if (idx == vertices.length) //
885            flush();
886
887        // bottom left and top right corner points relative to origin
888        final float worldOriginX = x + originX;
889        final float worldOriginY = y + originY;
890        float fx = -originX;
891        float fy = -originY;
892        float fx2 = width - originX;
893        float fy2 = height - originY;
894
895        // scale
896        if (scaleX != 1 || scaleY != 1) {
897            fx *= scaleX;
898            fy *= scaleY;
899            fx2 *= scaleX;
900            fy2 *= scaleY;
901        }
902
903        // construct corner points, start from top left and go counter clockwise
904        final float p1x = fx;
905        final float p1y = fy;
906        final float p2x = fx;
907        final float p2y = fy2;
908        final float p3x = fx2;
909        final float p3y = fy2;
910        final float p4x = fx2;
911        final float p4y = fy;
912
913        float x1;
914        float y1;
915        float x2;
916        float y2;
917        float x3;
918        float y3;
919        float x4;
920        float y4;
921
922        // rotate
923        if (rotation != 0) {
924            final float cos = MathUtils.cosDeg(rotation);
925            final float sin = MathUtils.sinDeg(rotation);
926
927            x1 = cos * p1x - sin * p1y;
928            y1 = sin * p1x + cos * p1y;
929
930            x2 = cos * p2x - sin * p2y;
931            y2 = sin * p2x + cos * p2y;
932
933            x3 = cos * p3x - sin * p3y;
934            y3 = sin * p3x + cos * p3y;
935
936            x4 = x1 + (x3 - x2);
937            y4 = y3 - (y2 - y1);
938        } else {
939            x1 = p1x;
940            y1 = p1y;
941
942            x2 = p2x;
943            y2 = p2y;
944
945            x3 = p3x;
946            y3 = p3y;
947
948            x4 = p4x;
949            y4 = p4y;
950        }
951
952        x1 += worldOriginX;
953        y1 += worldOriginY;
954        x2 += worldOriginX;
955        y2 += worldOriginY;
956        x3 += worldOriginX;
957        y3 += worldOriginY;
958        x4 += worldOriginX;
959        y4 += worldOriginY;
960
961        final float u = region.getU();
962        final float v = region.getV2();
963        final float u2 = region.getU2();
964        final float v2 = region.getV();
965
966        final float color = this.color;
967        final float tweak = this.tweak;
968        final int idx = this.idx;
969        vertices[idx] = x1;
970        vertices[idx + 1] = y1;
971        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
972        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
973        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
974        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
975
976        vertices[idx + 6] = x2;
977        vertices[idx + 7] = y2;
978        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
979        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
980        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
981        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
982
983        vertices[idx + 12] = x3;
984        vertices[idx + 13] = y3;
985        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
986        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
987        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
988        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
989
990        vertices[idx + 18] = x4;
991        vertices[idx + 19] = y4;
992        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
993        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
994        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
995        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
996        this.idx = idx + 24;
997    }
998
999    @Override
1000    public void draw (TextureRegion region, float x, float y, float originX, float originY, float width, float height,
1001                      float scaleX, float scaleY, float rotation, boolean clockwise) {
1002        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
1003
1004        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
1005
1006        Texture texture = region.getTexture();
1007        if (texture != lastTexture) {
1008            switchTexture(texture);
1009        } else if (idx == vertices.length) //
1010            flush();
1011
1012        // bottom left and top right corner points relative to origin
1013        final float worldOriginX = x + originX;
1014        final float worldOriginY = y + originY;
1015        float fx = -originX;
1016        float fy = -originY;
1017        float fx2 = width - originX;
1018        float fy2 = height - originY;
1019
1020        // scale
1021        if (scaleX != 1 || scaleY != 1) {
1022            fx *= scaleX;
1023            fy *= scaleY;
1024            fx2 *= scaleX;
1025            fy2 *= scaleY;
1026        }
1027
1028        // construct corner points, start from top left and go counter clockwise
1029        final float p1x = fx;
1030        final float p1y = fy;
1031        final float p2x = fx;
1032        final float p2y = fy2;
1033        final float p3x = fx2;
1034        final float p3y = fy2;
1035        final float p4x = fx2;
1036        final float p4y = fy;
1037
1038        float x1;
1039        float y1;
1040        float x2;
1041        float y2;
1042        float x3;
1043        float y3;
1044        float x4;
1045        float y4;
1046
1047        // rotate
1048        if (rotation != 0) {
1049            final float cos = MathUtils.cosDeg(rotation);
1050            final float sin = MathUtils.sinDeg(rotation);
1051
1052            x1 = cos * p1x - sin * p1y;
1053            y1 = sin * p1x + cos * p1y;
1054
1055            x2 = cos * p2x - sin * p2y;
1056            y2 = sin * p2x + cos * p2y;
1057
1058            x3 = cos * p3x - sin * p3y;
1059            y3 = sin * p3x + cos * p3y;
1060
1061            x4 = x1 + (x3 - x2);
1062            y4 = y3 - (y2 - y1);
1063        } else {
1064            x1 = p1x;
1065            y1 = p1y;
1066
1067            x2 = p2x;
1068            y2 = p2y;
1069
1070            x3 = p3x;
1071            y3 = p3y;
1072
1073            x4 = p4x;
1074            y4 = p4y;
1075        }
1076
1077        x1 += worldOriginX;
1078        y1 += worldOriginY;
1079        x2 += worldOriginX;
1080        y2 += worldOriginY;
1081        x3 += worldOriginX;
1082        y3 += worldOriginY;
1083        x4 += worldOriginX;
1084        y4 += worldOriginY;
1085
1086        float u1, v1, u2, v2, u3, v3, u4, v4;
1087        if (clockwise) {
1088            u1 = region.getU2();
1089            v1 = region.getV2();
1090            u2 = region.getU();
1091            v2 = region.getV2();
1092            u3 = region.getU();
1093            v3 = region.getV();
1094            u4 = region.getU2();
1095            v4 = region.getV();
1096        } else {
1097            u1 = region.getU();
1098            v1 = region.getV();
1099            u2 = region.getU2();
1100            v2 = region.getV();
1101            u3 = region.getU2();
1102            v3 = region.getV2();
1103            u4 = region.getU();
1104            v4 = region.getV2();
1105        }
1106
1107        final float color = this.color;
1108        final float tweak = this.tweak;
1109        final int idx = this.idx;
1110        vertices[idx] = x1;
1111        vertices[idx + 1] = y1;
1112        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
1113        vertices[idx + 3] = u1;
1114        vertices[idx + 4] = v1;
1115        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
1116
1117        vertices[idx + 6] = x2;
1118        vertices[idx + 7] = y2;
1119        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
1120        vertices[idx + 9] = u2;
1121        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
1122        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
1123
1124        vertices[idx + 12] = x3;
1125        vertices[idx + 13] = y3;
1126        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
1127        vertices[idx + 15] = u3;
1128        vertices[idx + 16] = v3;
1129        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
1130
1131        vertices[idx + 18] = x4;
1132        vertices[idx + 19] = y4;
1133        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
1134        vertices[idx + 21] = u4;
1135        vertices[idx + 22] = v4;
1136        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
1137        this.idx = idx + 24;
1138    }
1139
1140    @Override
1141    public void draw (TextureRegion region, float width, float height, Affine2 transform) {
1142        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
1143
1144        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
1145
1146        Texture texture = region.getTexture();
1147        if (texture != lastTexture) {
1148            switchTexture(texture);
1149        } else if (idx == vertices.length) {
1150            flush();
1151        }
1152
1153        // construct corner points
1154        float x1 = transform.m02;
1155        float y1 = transform.m12;
1156        float x2 = transform.m01 * height + transform.m02;
1157        float y2 = transform.m11 * height + transform.m12;
1158        float x3 = transform.m00 * width + transform.m01 * height + transform.m02;
1159        float y3 = transform.m10 * width + transform.m11 * height + transform.m12;
1160        float x4 = transform.m00 * width + transform.m02;
1161        float y4 = transform.m10 * width + transform.m12;
1162
1163        float u = region.getU();
1164        float v = region.getV2();
1165        float u2 = region.getV2();
1166        float v2 = region.getV();
1167
1168        final float color = this.color;
1169        final float tweak = this.tweak;
1170        final int idx = this.idx;
1171        vertices[idx] = x1;
1172        vertices[idx + 1] = y1;
1173        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
1174        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
1175        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
1176        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
1177
1178        vertices[idx + 6] = x2;
1179        vertices[idx + 7] = y2;
1180        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
1181        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
1182        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
1183        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
1184
1185        vertices[idx + 12] = x3;
1186        vertices[idx + 13] = y3;
1187        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
1188        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
1189        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
1190        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
1191
1192        vertices[idx + 18] = x4;
1193        vertices[idx + 19] = y4;
1194        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
1195        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
1196        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
1197        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
1198        this.idx = idx + 24;
1199    }
1200
1201    @SuppressWarnings("RedundantCast") // These casts are absolutely not redundant! Java 9 changed Buffer ABI.
1202    @Override
1203    public void flush () {
1204        if (idx == 0) return;
1205
1206        renderCalls++;
1207        totalRenderCalls++;
1208        int spritesInBatch = idx / SPRITE_SIZE;
1209        if (spritesInBatch > maxSpritesInBatch) maxSpritesInBatch = spritesInBatch;
1210        int count = spritesInBatch * 6;
1211
1212        lastTexture.bind();
1213        Mesh mesh = this.mesh;
1214        mesh.setVertices(vertices, 0, idx);
1215        ((Buffer)mesh.getIndicesBuffer()).position(0);
1216        ((Buffer)mesh.getIndicesBuffer()).limit(count);
1217
1218        if (blendingDisabled) {
1219            Gdx.gl.glDisable(GL20.GL_BLEND);
1220        } else {
1221            Gdx.gl.glEnable(GL20.GL_BLEND);
1222            if (blendSrcFunc != -1) Gdx.gl.glBlendFuncSeparate(blendSrcFunc, blendDstFunc, blendSrcFuncAlpha, blendDstFuncAlpha);
1223        }
1224
1225        mesh.render(customShader != null ? customShader : shader, GL20.GL_TRIANGLES, 0, count);
1226
1227        idx = 0;
1228    }
1229
1230    @Override
1231    public void disableBlending () {
1232        if (blendingDisabled) return;
1233        flush();
1234        blendingDisabled = true;
1235    }
1236
1237    @Override
1238    public void enableBlending () {
1239        if (!blendingDisabled) return;
1240        flush();
1241        blendingDisabled = false;
1242    }
1243
1244    @Override
1245    public void setBlendFunction (int srcFunc, int dstFunc) {
1246        setBlendFunctionSeparate(srcFunc, dstFunc, srcFunc, dstFunc);
1247    }
1248
1249    @Override
1250    public void setBlendFunctionSeparate(int srcFuncColor, int dstFuncColor, int srcFuncAlpha, int dstFuncAlpha) {
1251        if (blendSrcFunc == srcFuncColor && blendDstFunc == dstFuncColor && blendSrcFuncAlpha == srcFuncAlpha && blendDstFuncAlpha == dstFuncAlpha) return;
1252        flush();
1253        blendSrcFunc = srcFuncColor;
1254        blendDstFunc = dstFuncColor;
1255        blendSrcFuncAlpha = srcFuncAlpha;
1256        blendDstFuncAlpha = dstFuncAlpha;
1257    }
1258
1259    @Override
1260    public int getBlendSrcFunc () {
1261        return blendSrcFunc;
1262    }
1263
1264    @Override
1265    public int getBlendDstFunc () {
1266        return blendDstFunc;
1267    }
1268
1269    @Override
1270    public int getBlendSrcFuncAlpha() {
1271        return blendSrcFuncAlpha;
1272    }
1273
1274    @Override
1275    public int getBlendDstFuncAlpha() {
1276        return blendDstFuncAlpha;
1277    }
1278
1279    @Override
1280    public void dispose () {
1281        mesh.dispose();
1282        if (ownsShader && shader != null) shader.dispose();
1283    }
1284
1285    @Override
1286    public Matrix4 getProjectionMatrix () {
1287        return projectionMatrix;
1288    }
1289
1290    @Override
1291    public Matrix4 getTransformMatrix () {
1292        return transformMatrix;
1293    }
1294
1295    @Override
1296    public void setProjectionMatrix (Matrix4 projection) {
1297        if (drawing) flush();
1298        projectionMatrix.set(projection);
1299        if (drawing) setupMatrices();
1300    }
1301
1302    @Override
1303    public void setTransformMatrix (Matrix4 transform) {
1304        if (drawing) flush();
1305        transformMatrix.set(transform);
1306        if (drawing) setupMatrices();
1307    }
1308
1309    protected void setupMatrices () {
1310        combinedMatrix.set(projectionMatrix).mul(transformMatrix);
1311        if (customShader != null) {
1312            customShader.setUniformMatrix("u_projTrans", combinedMatrix);
1313            customShader.setUniformi("u_texture", 0);
1314        } else {
1315            shader.setUniformMatrix("u_projTrans", combinedMatrix);
1316            shader.setUniformi("u_texture", 0);
1317        }
1318    }
1319
1320    protected void switchTexture (Texture texture) {
1321        flush();
1322        lastTexture = texture;
1323        invTexWidth = 1.0f / texture.getWidth();
1324        invTexHeight = 1.0f / texture.getHeight();
1325    }
1326
1327    @Override
1328    public void setShader (ShaderProgram shader) {
1329        if (drawing) {
1330            flush();
1331        }
1332        customShader = shader;
1333        if (drawing) {
1334            if (customShader != null)
1335                customShader.bind();
1336            else
1337                this.shader.bind();
1338            setupMatrices();
1339        }
1340    }
1341
1342    @Override
1343    public ShaderProgram getShader () {
1344        if (customShader == null) {
1345            return shader;
1346        }
1347        return customShader;
1348    }
1349
1350    @Override
1351    public boolean isBlendingEnabled () {
1352        return !blendingDisabled;
1353    }
1354
1355    public boolean isDrawing () {
1356        return drawing;
1357    }
1358    static public final int X1 = 0;
1359    static public final int Y1 = 1;
1360    static public final int C1 = 2;
1361    static public final int U1 = 3;
1362    static public final int V1 = 4;
1363    static public final int T1 = 5;
1364    static public final int X2 = 6;
1365    static public final int Y2 = 7;
1366    static public final int C2 = 8;
1367    static public final int U2 = 9;
1368    static public final int V2 = 10;
1369    static public final int T2 = 11;
1370    static public final int X3 = 12;
1371    static public final int Y3 = 13;
1372    static public final int C3 = 14;
1373    static public final int U3 = 15;
1374    static public final int V3 = 16;
1375    static public final int T3 = 17;
1376    static public final int X4 = 18;
1377    static public final int Y4 = 19;
1378    static public final int C4 = 20;
1379    static public final int U4 = 21;
1380    static public final int V4 = 22;
1381    static public final int T4 = 23;
1382}
